sourceMeaningMnemonic: Put a <radical>lid</radical> on something <radical>spicy</radical> and you'll cook up pure <kanji>happiness</kanji>.
meaningInfo: Spicy foods literally do trigger happy chemicals in your brain. It wouldn't be too far off to say that putting a lid on a pot filled with something spicy could produce happiness.
readingMnemonic: Out of spicy foods you made pure <kanji>happiness</kanji>. You give it to your sad friend <ja><reading>こう</reading>いち</ja>, who waits at the table.
readingInfo: <ja>こういち</ja> looks sad. But when you serve him happiness, he starts to perk up a bit. A couple more bites of happiness, and there's a smile on his face. Although when you found <ja>こういち</ja> he was depressed, down on his luck, and hiding from the government, cooking him some spicy foods seems to have brought him some happiness.
